title-group.article-title: Lessons Learned from the MBA Program for a Successful Online MSF Program

abstract.p: The recent shift towards online education portends the development of specialized master’s programs such as the Master of Science in Finance (MSF) program. In this paper, we translate lessons learned from the online MBA program to produce a successful specialized graduate finance program, with the potential of reaching a larger global market. We aim to extrapolate on the potential for success of the online MSF by evaluating the efficacy of the long running online MBA program at our university, the Corporate MBA (CMBA). All Professional MBA (PMBA) programs, including the CMBA, share equivalent student learning outcomes and curriculum. We compare admission standards, retention data, and end of program assessments to analyze the common characteristics that preclude student success under the two separate modes of instruction. The paper describes further measures necessary to enhance the value of an online program. Through this study, the authors hope to advance the discussion of graduate online education in Finance to service a more extensive customer base while ensuring better-prepared graduates.
